title_sort: walt whitman to richard w. colles, 18 november 1886
title: Walt Whitman to Richard W. Colles, 18 November 1886
text: letter sent to R W Colles, Dublin | Nov: 18 '1886Yours of 31st and 1st rec'd. I send the two Vols: of '76 Ed'n. I should accept with thanks from your hands any contribution from my Irish friends (Prof. Edw'd Dowden has already contributed liberally, & should not be solicited any further) Take leisure and ease ab't it & let it amount to what it may—or naught at all, if Destiny so disposes.(tr to last Send me word if the two Vols. reach you safely. The price is £2, which please remit me by p. o. order.) Yes, I should like to see the article in the Quarterly. My late bad spell of sickness seems to have passed over—I was out driving yesterday the three sunny midday hours, & enjoyed them much. Walt Whitman to Richard W. Colles, 18 November 1886
